meanings.definition: To exaggerate the merits of (something) beyond what is justified.
meanings.sent1: Some people tend to overhype their achievements to impress others.
meanings.sent2: The company tried to overhype their new product by making bold claims.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how some movies overhype themselves only to disappoint in the end.
meanings.sent4: Her friends always overhype her cooking skills, but in reality, it's just average.
meanings.sent5: The marketing team tends to overhype every event to attract more attendees.

meanings.sent1: Don't overhype the event too much, or people might lose interest.
meanings.sent2: The company tends to overhype their sales to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how they overhype their new movie as the best of the year.
meanings.sent4: The politician's team always overhypes his speeches to gain more support.
meanings.sent5: The media tends to overhype celebrity gossip to increase viewership.
